articles.author: Andrew Mills, Humeyra Pamuk, Matt Spetalnick
articles.description: Donald Trump's incoming Middle East envoy has traveled to Qatar and Israel to kick-start the U.S. president-elect's diplomatic push to reach a Gaza ceasefire and hostage release deal before he takes office on Jan 20, a source briefed on the talks told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Trump's Middle East envoy in diplomatic push to reach Gaza ceasefire before inauguration

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The no-confidence motions are all but certain to oust the government, throwing the euro zone's second-biggest economy deeper into a lingering political crisis.
articles.title: French lawmakers set to vote on ousting Prime Minister Barnier

articles.author: Felix Light
articles.description: The leader of Georgia's main opposition party has been detained by police in the capital Tbilisi after being knocked to the ground and falling unconscious, his party said, the most high-profile in a sweeping wave of arrests of senior opposition figures.
articles.title: Georgian opposition figures arrested as pro-EU protests continue

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The fall of France's government on Wednesday and the failure to pass a budget could make it difficult for Paris to ramp up its support for Ukraine despite President Emmanuel Macron's repeated promises to help Kyiv for as long as necessary.
articles.title: French government collapse raises questions over Ukraine support

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mexican security forces said on Wednesday they had made the largest fentanyl seizure in the country's history, impounding 1,100 kilograms of the synthetic opioid in the state of Sinaloa.
articles.title: Mexico nabs over a ton of fentanyl in largest ever seizure

articles.author: Joyce Lee, Hyunjoo Jin
articles.description: South Korea's parliament formally introduced a motion on Thursday to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol over a botched attempt to impose martial law, but his party vowed to oppose the move, throwing the process into doubt.
articles.title: South Korean ruling party to oppose Yoon's impeachment

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: WA Ukrainian delegation met on Wednesday with senior representatives of President-elect Donald Trump, a source familiar with the meeting said, as Ukraine seeks support from the incoming team in its war to repel Russian invaders.
articles.title: Ukraine's Yermak meets senior Trump advisers, source says

articles.author: Amina Niasse, Kyoko Gasha
articles.description: Brian Thompson, the CEO of UnitedHealth's insurance unit, was fatally shot on Wednesday morning outside a midtown Manhattan hotel, several media outlets reported, just before a scheduled company investor conference.
articles.title: UnitedHealthcare executive fatally shot in Manhattan, reports say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Colombia's President Gustavo Petro on Wednesday said he expects his Finance Minister Ricardo Bonilla to resign amid an ongoing corruption scandal, though the president said he does not think the minister has committed any wrongdoing.
articles.title: Colombia's Petro says expects resignation of finance minister amid scandal

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli tanks pushed into northern parts of the Khan Younis area in the south of the Gaza Strip on Wednesday and Palestinian medics said Israeli airstrikes had killed at least 20 people across the enclave.
articles.title: Israeli forces advance in Khan Younis area of southern Gaza, 20 killed across enclave
